title: NASA on track to decide new approach for MSR by end of year
summary: NASA officials say the agency is on track to decide by the end of the year how to revise the Mars Sample Return (MSR) architecture to lower its costs and shorten its schedule.

title: Space Force to increase spending on low Earth orbit satellite services
summary: The Proliferated Low Earth Orbit satellite services program, launched in 2023, has already used $660 million of its allocated $900 million budget in just over a year

title: CNES to Flight Test Early Prototype of a European Spacesuit
summary: The French space agency CNES has published a call for the development, manufacture, and flight testing of an early prototype of a European intravehicular activity (IVA) spacesuit. Between late 2023 and early 2024, Spartan Space, the Institute of Space Medicine and Physiology (MEDES), and the sporting goods retailer Decathlon were contracted by CNES to complete […]

title: China launches 3 Tianping-3 radar calibration satellites
summary: HELSINKI — China launched a trio of satellites late Monday for ground radar equipment calibration and other measurements. A Long March 6 rocket lifted off from Taiyuan Satellite Launch Center, […]

title: Launch Roundup: SpaceX approaches 400th orbital flight; Blue Origin, China, Japan launch missions
summary: This week will see a fourth flight of the Japanese H3 rocket carrying a communications satellite for the Japanese military and two launches from China. Blue Origin will attempt to test its second human-rated New Shepard capsule, which has been delayed twice since the start of the month.

title: Live coverage: SpaceX to launch 68th Starlink mission of 2024 as it seeks permission to operate nearly 30,000 Gen2 satellites
summary: The mission will bring the total number of orbital launches from Florida in 2024 to 72, tying the total for 2023. Liftoff is set for  no earlier than 7:38 p.m. EDT (2338 UTC) from pad 40 at Cape Canaveral Space Force Station.

title: Luxembourg joins OQ Technology’s 30 million euro investment plan
summary: Luxembourg’s government has backed a significant chunk of OQ Technology’s ongoing 30 million euro ($32 million) Series B funding round, according to the Luxembourg-based operator of small narrowband satellites.

title: NASA Invites Media to Chile Artemis Accords Signing Ceremony
summary: Chile will sign the Artemis Accords during a ceremony at 3 p.m. EDT on Friday, Oct. 25, at NASA’s Headquarters in Washington. NASA Administrator Bill Nelson will host Aisén Etcheverry, Chile’s minister of science, technology, knowledge and innovation, and Juan Gabriel Valdés, ambassador of Chile to the United States, along with other officials from Chile and […]

title: On the Road Again…
summary: In this image from Oct. 3, 2024, NASA’s mobile launcher 1 makes its way back to the Vehicle Assembly Building at NASA’s Kennedy Space Center in Florida, after undergoing upgrades and tests in preparation for the agency’s Artemis II mission. Artemis II is the first crewed mission on NASA’s path to establishing a long-term presence […]
